meanings.definition: A person who has been released from prison on parole.
meanings.sent1: The parolee found a job to rebuild their life after prison.
meanings.sent2: The community welcomed the parolee back with open arms.
meanings.sent3: The parolee joked that their ankle monitor was their new fashion accessory.
meanings.sent4: The parolee's journey to redemption was like a phoenix rising from the ashes.
meanings.sent5: The parolee's determination to change shone brighter than the sun.

meanings.sent1: The judge decided to parole the prisoner after a successful rehabilitation program.
meanings.sent2: The parole board will carefully consider whether to parole the inmate early.
meanings.sent3: The warden teased that he would parole the prisoner to do his laundry.
meanings.sent4: The decision to parole the convict was like setting a bird free from its cage.
meanings.sent5: The authorities will parole the offender if they meet all the conditions.
